sub_title: Team Lead, Science in the Space Environment (SciSpacE), European Space Agency

profile_positions.location: Noordwijk aan Zee, South Holland, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the science in the space environment (SciSpacE) element of the Human and Robotic Exploration Directorate that includes life sciences, physical science and Moon and Mars science to be done on platforms and destinations of Earth, low Earth Orbit, Gateway platform, the Moon surface and Mars surface.
Accomplishments
- Through consultation with staff, human resources and management, defined terms of reference for Exploration Scientists and Discipline Leads which lead to the creation of a new functional organization in SciSpacE with clear roles for all staff
- Through interdirectorate consultation, created a new statement of work for the service contractors that was complementary to the staff terms of reference so that the contractors knew how what was expected of them and how their contributions benefit SciSpacE
- Through the creation of a SciSpacE strategy. ESA can point to a document that describes its science interests and objectives. 
- Led a team of staff and contractors to organize a 3-day SciSpacE Strategic Roadmapping Retreat that brought together 55 scientists from diverse research domains, to identify the key science questions and associated capabilities for the SciSpacE element and draft a SciSpacE Strategic Roadmap that links investments to science outcomes.
- Worked with an internal team to update the selection criteria for science competitions to reflect values, including science excellence, multidisciplinarity, and diversity, identified in the SciSpacE strategy. 
- Internationally, I have persuaded international partners, particularly NASA, that ESA is the European partner to deal with in LEO and Gateway matters, while instituting quarterly meetings with the member states involved in the International Life Sciences Working Group to ensure that Europe has a unified voice.
- I created science criteria to be considered when prioritizing missions for large financial investments in research.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Human and Robotic Exploration

company.name: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne

profile_positions.company: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the program development of the Life and Health Sciences Program and the utilization of the International Space Station (ISS).
Accomplishments 
- Designed basic research grants program to address data mining, model organism and human analogue research
- Created and drafted the Terms of Reference and coordinated the approval of the International Space Exploration Health Working Group by ISS partners
- Worked on government team working with Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada, the National Research Council and the Arctic Research Foundation on the mission and vision for food production for the Arctic and Space.
- Supervised the creation of archive database for ISS activities
- Managed health and life sciences program at the Canadian Space Agency
profile_positions.title: Chief Scientist, Life Sciences and the International Space Station

profile_positions.company: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne
profile_positions.description:
- Drafted Human Spaceflight Research and Development Plan that included guiding principles for prioritization of activities, roadmap, and stakeholder analysis
- Commissioned studies for future planning including:
- Environmental Scan (to map changing environment since last scan in 2011)
- Three surveys of Canadian capabilities in areas relevant to space health: (1) Radiation Protection, (2) Virtual Reality and (3) Human Factors
- Business plan for precision health
- Survey on obstacles between clinician and health scientist working together
- Created and co-chaired the Canadian Deep Space Gateway Radiation and Health Study Team bringing together scientists from the Health and Life Sciences and Planetary Exploration domains.
profile_positions.title: Temporary assignment to Space Exploration Planning Group

profile_positions.company: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the program development and science implementation  the Life and Health Sciences Program and the utilization of the International Space Station.
Accomplishments
- Developed 10-year International Space Station utilization plan that was the basis for successful funding request in 2016 federal budget and is being implemented
- Developed and managing the evolution of an open innovation model that has guided activities and identified partnerships 
- Represented CSA on international (International Space Life Sciences Working Group, International Space Exploration Coordination Group –Science Working Group), (international Space Station Utilization for Health Group-under United National Office of Outer Space Affairs) and national committees (Human Spaceflight Consultation Committee)
- Negotiated partnerships with other space agencies for space missions
profile_positions.title: Chief Scientist, International Space Station and Life and Health Sciences

profile_positions.company: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the program development and program implementation of Life and Physical Sciences
Accomplishments:
- Led the development and implementation of Life and Physical Sciences Roadmap
- Directed increased utilization of space for science with 13 missions on the International Space Station in 2007 and 2 more missions for the Russian recoverable satellite Foton (previous utilisation was maximum 2 missions per year) 
- Lead the writing of sections of the Canadian Space Agency Grants and Contribution program 
- Contributed to the development of a logic model for the Grants and Contribution program and for Space Sciences
- Re-invigorated the Physical Sciences program that had 0% success rate in international space science competitions to 70% success rate with Canadian proposals ranked 2,3,5 and 8 in last international competition
- As Official Languages Champion, developed plan for increasing second language competency within the CSA
- Assembled a research team with partners from industry, academia and other government departments to develop an astronaut food that was a probiotic fermented soy food.
- Assembled and managed team with support from industry and NSERC and interest from NASA
- Co-investigator on NSERC grant ($125,000 total grant amount) and co-investigator on OMAF grant ($50,000 total grant amount)
- Developed job requirements and evaluation criteria for staffing of senior scientist, program leads and program scientists
profile_positions.title: Director, Life and Physical Sciences

profile_positions.company: Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne
profile_positions.description:
Accomplishments: 
- Managed the Life Sciences program with support from 3 consultants
- Overhauled, managed and implemented Life Sciences ground studies as Concept and Feasibility studies
- Increased interest three-fold in research opportunities at CSA based on proposal submission
- Managed the international peer review of proposals 
- Acted as science authority for missions and hardware development
- As mission scientist for STS-107 supported the operations of OSTEO-2
     -  Communication activities
- Conducted communication activities for radio, television and press on behalf of CSA both before and immediately after the loss of STS-107
- Communicated space physical science on television program aired on the Discovery channel
profile_positions.title: Program Scientist, Life Sciences

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for development and instruction of scientific laboratories (120 students) and course instruction (36 students) 
Accomplishments
- Managed laboratory technician and supervised five groups of 30 students in weekly laboratory sessions of 4 hours
- Conceived of a novel laboratory session for the study of heritability that has been incorporated into the syllabus
profile_positions.title: Instructor, Champlain St. Lawrence-Champlain CEGEP
